tests_app.models module¶

class tests_app.models.Pregunta(*args, **kwargs)[fuente]¶

Bases: Model

Modelo que representa una pregunta dentro de un test.

Atributos:

  • test: Test al que pertenece la pregunta.

  • texto: Contenido de la pregunta.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
respuestas¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

test¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

test_id¶
texto¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class tests_app.models.Test(*args, **kwargs)[fuente]¶

Bases: Model

Modelo que representa un test.

Atributos:

  • autor: Usuario que creó el test.

  • nombre: Nombre del test (único).

  • descripcion: Descripción opcional del test.

  • fecha_creacion: Fecha y hora en que se creó el test.

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

autor¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

get_previous_by_fecha_creacion(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: fecha_creacion>, is_next=False, **kwargs)¶

nombre¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
preguntas¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

tests_app.tests module¶

tests_app.views module¶

tests_app.views.agregar_pregunta(request, pk)[fuente]¶

Vista para agregar una nueva pregunta a un test específico.

tests_app.views.crear_test(request)[fuente]¶

Vista para la creación de un nuevo test.

tests_app.views.editar_pregunta(request, pkPregunta, pkTest)[fuente]¶

Vista para editar una pregunta específica dentro de un test.

tests_app.views.eliminar_pregunta(request, pkPregunta, pkTest)[fuente]¶

Vista para eliminar una pregunta específica dentro de un test.

tests_app.views.eliminar_test(request, pk)[fuente]¶

Vista para eliminar un test existente.

tests_app.views.index(request)[fuente]¶

Vista para listar todos los tests disponibles.

tests_app.views.ver_preguntas(request, pk)[fuente]¶

Vista para mostrar todas las preguntas de un test específico.
